subject: Learning
title: Left Brain vs Right Brain
description: A short lesson to help you apply Left Brain vs Right Brain.

hook.text: Are you 'left-brained' and logical, or 'right-brained' and creative? Neither. That's a myth too.

buildup.text: The idea came from split-brain research in the 1960s, which studied patients with severed corpus callosums.

discovery.text: While some functions are lateralized, both hemispheres work together on virtually every task.

twist.text: A 2013 study of 1,000 brains found no evidence that people are dominated by one hemisphere.

climax.text: Creativity and logic both require whole-brain networks. You can't be 'half a brain person.'

punchline.text: You're not left or right brained. You're whole-brained.

quiz.question: What did a 2013 study of 1,000 brains find about hemispheric dominance?
options: No evidence that people are dominated by one hemisphere
Strong evidence for left-brain dominance in most people
